title: lispd: support IID on Map-Registers
message:
lispd: support IID on Map-Registers

Added new option 'iid' to the 'database-mapping' and 'static-map-cache'
sections of the configuration file and implemented support for
registering with Instance ID. When 'iid' is negative, no LCAF field is
generated and it is up to Map-Server implementation to use the default 0
IID. When a positive value is entered, a LCAF/IID field is added before
the EID when registering.

title: Merge pull request #17 from mportoles/multihoming

Merge pull request #17 from mportoles/multihoming

Handling SMRs and Map Registrations in Multihomed nodes

title: Extending map registration and SMR generation to account for
message:
Extending map registration and SMR generation to account for
multihoming.

The changes focus on considering active/inactive interfaces as follows,
- If just a single interface is used, nothing changes
- With more than one interface running, when an interface falls
the generation of SMRs is rate limited. This is done to prevent excessive
SMRs in the case a link is going up/down repeatedly.

title: Merge pull request #16 from mportoles/multihoming
message:
Merge pull request #16 from mportoles/multihoming

Multihoming

title: Added support to multihoming to lispd. It can run in two modes: legacy and multi-interface
message:
Added support to multihoming to lispd. It can run in two modes: legacy and multi-interface

Compilation options
- Legacy Mode: compile normally
- Multi-interface: add -DLISPMOBMH to CFLAGS in lispd/Makefile

Comments:
- Multi-interface: The control interface receives index 0.
- The Netfilter priority is downgraded from NF_IP_PRI_FIRST to NF_IP_PRI_LAST. This is to ensure that lisp_mod "captures" packets after they have been marked. (the mangle priority is NF_IP_PRI_MANGLE

Basic Functionality:
- The module lisp_mod selects the outgoing interface/rloc based on the value that each packet (sk_buff structure) carries, using the variable "mark".
- lispd assigns a "mark" value to each rloc, 0 being the default rloc.
- As of now lispd assigns as "mark" the ifindex of the interface associated to each rloc (see /sys/class/net/<device_name/ifindex
- Example of use:
  To force all packets with destination eid 10.0.1.2 use the interface with ifindex 2, we would use the following rule:
  iptables -t MANGLE -I OUTPUT -d 10.0.1.2 -j MARK --set-mark 2

Enabling simultaneous use of non-lisp interfaces

lisp_output(4 or 6) checks whether the src address of a packet is a local EID.
If this is the case the packet is encapsulated as usual, otherwise the packet
is lent to the kernel unmodified.

*to enable we need to add the -DTESTLOCALEID flag to the Makefile

Fix removal of kmem_cache_name() in 2.6.39

The kmem_cache_name() function is removed in kernel 2.6.39. The
kmem_cache structure had a member called 'name' since at least 2.6.27,
so update lisp_mod/tables.c to just use the struct member.

This commit removes the lispd_pkt_map_reply_eid_prefix_record_t and
lispd_pkt_map_reply_locator_t structures from lispd.h and replaces their
usage in lispd_map_reply.c with lispd_pkt_mapping_record_t and
lispd_pkt_mapping_record_locator_t respectively, since all packets use
the same mapping record format.

Fix switch statements

Fix whitespace and indentation according to coding style. Add missing
'break;' even after last label, see K&R:

    As a matter of good form, put a break after the last case even
    though it's logically unnecessary. Some day when another case gets
    added at the end, this bit of defensive programming will save you.

Previously we sent our own EID in both the Source-EID and mapping record
fields of the SMRs we were sending. Now we ask for the full map-cache
from the kernel, and put the destination EID prefix in the mapping
record field.

title: Add .gdbinit file to lispd/ folder
message:
Add .gdbinit file to lispd/ folder

  * Pass through Ctrl-C keypresses (the SIGINT signal) to lispd
  * Add macros to print IPv4 and IPv6 addresses

title: Send Map-Replies to the correct port. Fixes gh-6
message: Send Map-Replies to the correct port. Fixes gh-6

title: No garbage locator to map-cache when no PETR
message:
No garbage locator to map-cache when no PETR

Fix a bug which caused random data to be sent to the data plane when a
negative Map-Reply was received and no Proxy-ETR configured.

title: Fix a segfault + whitespace cleanup
message: Fix a segfault + whitespace cleanup

title: Map-Reply record is sent based on requested EID
message:
Map-Reply record is sent based on requested EID

Before this commit, the EID prefix was not inspected in a Map-Request,
and a Map-Reply was sent will one configured EID from each address
family, regardless of what was being asked. Now a reply is only sent if
the requested EID prefix matches one in the database.

title: Send mapping records for all EIDs in Map-Replies
message:
Send mapping records for all EIDs in Map-Replies

Previously, a Map-Reply with an IPv6 EID mapping reccord would have been
sent, of an IPv6 EID was configured, an IPv4 record otherwise. This
commit changes the behaviour, so that one EID for each AFI is returned,
when available.

Code should be changed so that reply depends on the actual request.

title: Fix EID interface default gateway bug
message:
Fix EID interface default gateway bug

Default gateway was not set for IPv6 on the EID interface. Change the
way the default gateway is added on that interface from
    ip route add default via <EID> dev <iface>
to
    ip route add default dev <iface>
